website_summaries.verdict: A top-seller in its class thanks to its combination of durability, convenience, and food-protecting qualities.
pros: Keep food fresh and accessible – heavy-duty construction, BPA-free materials, air and watertight patented "spin" lid
Patented sealing system also keeps out bugs and pests
cons: Aren't exactly true to their rated weight capacities – they hold slightly less food
Some consumers didn't receive the scoop that comes with it

customer_reviews.title: Container fails due to stress cracks
customer_reviews.text: Excited to have a bombproof food storage container for dog food. Container is impressive looking and seems sturdy at first but soon developed stress cracks on the main part of the collar. 1 year warranty is a joke. Provided all documentation to the manufacturer but never heard back after several attempts. Don't waste your money. Terrible product but much worse customer service. Give your money to a company who cares.
customer_reviews.author: wprpac

customer_reviews.title: Not pest proof
customer_reviews.text: Completely unhappy with the product. I bought this to put my dog food in and I didn’t even have it for a full day and a rodent chewed right through it. I was under the impression that these were pest proof but they definitely are not. Very disappointed and a waste of time. I am also having to replace all of the dog food that was in the container, as it is now full of little plastic pieces and is unsafe to give my pets.
customer_reviews.author: Mackenzie

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: After putting a $70 bag of food in the container and coming back to find it full of ants, I thought maybe I didn't close the lid tight enough. I filled out with water, tightened the lid, turned it over, and the water came pouring out from under the lip (not the lid). Now it's too late to turn and I can't figure out how to contact the seller.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara K.

customer_reviews.title: Don't market something as airtight if it's not....
customer_reviews.text: Received this "airtight" 50lb container today for my dogs food only to find out that the container is not airtight. When the cap is completely screwed on and little pressure is applied to the sides, you can hear air escaping. Do these products get tested before they get sent out?? I'm beyond aggravated, please make a product that is actually airtight and stop wasting peoples time and money. I will be returning this immediately, I might as well just resort to duct tape on the dog food bag.
customer_reviews.author: Webb

customer_reviews.title: Leaks not water tight
customer_reviews.text: Received the product today had a heavy plastic smell went to wash it put a little bit of mild soap and water into the container no matter how I screwed on the lid water leaked out of the lid I bought this for a watertight container it is not.
customer_reviews.author: D Fish

customer_reviews.title: It leaks
customer_reviews.text: I guess these aren't meant for outdoor use because water comes in around the top and ruins the food. I'm not sure why it doesn't have a lid that wraps down around the edges. The lid appears to be equivalent to one of those 5-gallon bucket screw tops so might as well save your money and just go that route.
customer_reviews.author: JMS

customer_reviews.title: German Shepherd Tested!!
customer_reviews.text: I have two GSDs. One has perfect manners. The one in the attached pic is a Houdini - she can open doors and containers. I finally spent the extra $$ and bought the 50-lb capacity container shown. So I ran a test - I left the back pantry open and left the house. Came back to the container dragged/pushed 15 ft into the kitchen. How she got the container holding 25 lbs of food that far beats me. Anyway, the container has paid for itself. She couldn't budge the screw-on top.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Not critter-proof
customer_reviews.text: This bin is not critter-proof! The reviews claim it was bear-proof, but that must have been one lazy bear. Based on the evidence, it seems a raccoon was able to eat its way through the cover. I wasn’t in love with it anyway. It is huge and hard to maneuver once filled. I suppose it is strictly an indoor storage bin. Lesson learned!
customer_reviews.author: TG

customer_reviews.title: awesome so far
customer_reviews.text: i had been using an airtight plastic container for about 4 years before it started to weather and deteriorate, so i got this to replace it and hopefully last a bit longer as well. with two big dogs to feed, i buy 44lb bags every 2 weeks. this container holds the entire bag with room to spare. the lid is sure to keep out any critters trying to get to the food. and if this lasts for more than 5 years outside in a covered patio, i will consider this sturdy enough, and a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: BINOBINOBINO

customer_reviews.title: Didn't keep the mice out
customer_reviews.text: Started putting the dry pet food in these as some mice had found their way into the bags we use to keep. The mice chewed through the lid. Only took them about a week to get all the way in. Not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: roband

customer_reviews.title: The idea of this vault is great. 50 pounds of dog food will not fit
customer_reviews.text: The idea of this vault is great. 50 pounds of dog food will not fit. We had it 5 days when a rodent chewed through the tip of the container rendering it useless. I emailed the company with no response. Would not recommend for outdoor use or for large quantities of large kibble.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you have a dog that can get into any food container, or Florida bugs this is for you
customer_reviews.text: I just bought one of these Vittles Vaults for my dogs food. My daughter has had one for years, it has been sturdy, tight seal, bug proof, dog proof. Her Lab Molly is food driven, she has opened cabinet doors and drawers, zipped lunch bags, purses, garbage cans, she found easter candy on the second floor in a drawer of a dresser, opened the drawer then the plastic eggs and ate all the chocolate, went down stairs and threw up all the chocolate. This container has been as solid and secure as Fort Knox, poor Molly has yet to gain access. For me as long as it keeps the bugs out I'm happy
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth G.

customer_reviews.title: Beware--can scratch your wood floor if dragged.
customer_reviews.text: This product has been great for us so far EXCEPT my daughter pulled it across our floor to get it closer to the food dish (7 year old problem solving) and it left a long jagged scratch in our wood floor. We have used Rubbermaid containers for storage in the past and they have been dragged from time to time and we did not have the same issue with them scratching our floor. In all other senses, though, this is an upgrade on a Rubbermaid container. So just don't let your 7 year old handle it and you'll be fine...
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: It leaks
customer_reviews.text: It began taking on water within 2 1/2 months. I couldn't find any holes, cracks nothing! I just had 50 lbs of horse feed ruined😞... Maybe I just had a defective one, idk...
customer_reviews.author: Mistyr69

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Pet Food Container
customer_reviews.text: Needed to get a new container, as our old container used to get ants, moths and other pest inside the food...some people will say it's not a problem, but we'd prefer our dogs to not eat that nor bring that inside. (+): Most durable container I've used, easily keeps bugs and pests out, includes a 1 cup food scooper, easy to maneuver with built-in handle cutouts, small foot print and large capacity. (-): Doesn't quite hold 50lbs. of food, but I'm sure it's dependent on the kibble volume. We have 2 small breeds of dogs and 40lbs. of food fills this up to about 95% capacity. Minus 1-star for the inaccurate weight report. Highly recommend and well worth the cost!
customer_reviews.author: PW

customer_reviews.title: small hole on side
customer_reviews.text: i recieved this product a few months ago, and have been using it since (or attempting to). i kept finding ants and bugs in the dog food, and couldnt figure out why. turns out there was a small hole on the side i hadnt noticed. im not sure how well this product works and ive kept it away from anything sharp, so im pretty sure this is how i received it. wouldve reviewed earlier but i hadnt gotten around to it.
customer_reviews.author: Fausto Buenrostro

customer_reviews.title: Blows Away Old Storage Bin
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that this thing seals up air tight. I have a mouse infiltration somewhere in my house and I’m trying to keep any food source away from them. I easily fit 30 lbs of dog food in here but could definitely fit more if I purchased a bigger bag. I have seen some people throw the whole bag in here, I personally didn’t try that because it looked to be too daunting of a task. The top opening isn’t very wide and I felt like I would rip the bag open so I just dump the food in. I don’t mind cleaning it now and again.
customer_reviews.author: Chicken Keeper

customer_reviews.title: Using for Rice
customer_reviews.text: I have 50 lbs of Rice to store so I bought the 50 lb container. When I poured the 50 lbs of Rice in, it only took up about 3/4 of the container. I think the container is meant for kibble, 50 lbs of which probably occupies more area than 50 lbs of Rice. I guess I should have considered the density of 50 lbs of rice vs 50 lbs of kibble. If you want to store rice or grain, you could probably use a smaller container (the 30 lb one might suffice). The height of this container is 20 inches, which is approx up to my knee. I
customer_reviews.author: M. L. Barrett

customer_reviews.title: Does what it promises
customer_reviews.text: Been using this bad Johnnie for about 2 years and I've never found a bug or moisture in my dog's food. The only bug I have to deal with is my cats when 2:30pm rolls around and they think it's 5pm and time for dinnies and won't shut the hell up and pretend they love me to get my attention. I gave 5 stars for "freshness" category, but I've never eaten a piece of kibble out of it. I guess I could put some Doritos in there for a week and see how she goes. Just get it. It fits them big bags from Costco too just fyi.
customer_reviews.author: Dumps

customer_reviews.title: Very nice sturdy container
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE...the large O-ring Seal on the lid is already bad at 5 months!!! It just falls off the lid! Probably wouldn't buy this again. MY INITIAL REVIEW: My daughter bought one of these about 5 years ago and I was impressed how strong they are. We just got a large dog so needed enough to store 50lbs of food, this works great! I like it because it is well manufactured and has a nice rubber seal at the top, looks like you could replace is if needed. The last container I had was cheap plastic that cracked, this one should last a lifetime. Would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for any large amount of food storage.
customer_reviews.text: I, like many others, began making my own bread over Quarantine. Instead of buying tiny bags of flour, we opted to get 50lb+ bags. With no where to properly store them, we opted to get these. One contains a mix of rye flour and all purpose flour and the other contains bread flour. They move easily around our viynl floor in the kitchen for regular use. They seal very well, ensuring the flour doesn't get those pesky moths. Great buy for any large amount of food storage. I did wash out the container very well in my bathtub before completely drying and using.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Safe Food Storage
customer_reviews.text: I can say that I am quite pleased with this purchase. I bought 2, 1 for cat food and one for dog food. I wanted a storage that would help keep the food fresher for longer, while also keeping it secure. It does seem to keep longer, keeps out any elements, and animals are not able to get into them. I would have liked to see some type of seal ring however other than just the screw tops. They are overall easy to twist open and closed and both came with a cup. I would recommend these for safe food storage.
customer_reviews.author: Kitsune

customer_reviews.title: not the size it says
customer_reviews.text: This says it holds 50 pounds of dig food I out a 27 pound bag of dog food in and it is full. No way this will hold 50 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't hold what it says it does.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to keep outside to feed a neighborhood cat. I bought the "Holds 50 pounds" size, because the cat food I buy comes in 44 pound bags. This bin hold exactly 33 pounds (I weighed to make sure). So, on top of not holding what it says, the rubber seal ring for the lid stretched out just from opening the lid, and it no longer fits. Finally, some sort of outside animal (I suspect a raccoon) chewed a 2-inch hole in the bottom edge of the bin within the first 10 days. Overall, pretty disappointed with this product. Doesn't hold as much as it claims, seal ring is low-quality, and materials are apparently fairly easy to chew through.
customer_reviews.author: Beannaithe

customer_reviews.title: Almost amazing
customer_reviews.text: The capacity indicated is not what it actually holds. A 50# bag of dog food was too much. I had to scoop out some so it could close. I stacked 2 and the bottom container started to cave in. The food is fresh, the dogs are happy. It clear conceals odors because the dogs are unaware of it when they are hungry. They know food is there because they walk with us when it's eating time, but not they smell it. no insects as advertised. I think about getting more...maybe. I did add a tarp cover to keep out water (just in case) because it is rainy season.
customer_reviews.author: IslandFaves

customer_reviews.title: Not a 100% seal.
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice container. I got the 50lb. When it came, I put some water in it and put the lid on. It dripped around the lid when I turned it upside down. Not a WHOLE lot, but it does drip. I tightened the lid as much as possible. Still dripped. I'm keeping it. I don't have a pest problem and I think it'll keep the food fairly fresh. Just one star deducted for not living up to airtight. Update: taking off another star because the rubber seal falls off the lid every time I unscrew it.
customer_reviews.author: JBrown

customer_reviews.title: Good product but it broke with minimal use
customer_reviews.text: It's a solid product and served it's purpose (storing birdseed) for a few months. I never moved it or anything like that. It's got a snap-on collar that receives the threaded lid, and this collar split along the circumference and now the assembly is neither air nor water tight so that kinda sucks. I've only filled it twice in the ~5 months I've had it. The unit came assembled and I'm guessing they just put a little too much into banging the collar on the container. Seller, if you're listening, I'd be happy with a new collar. I don't see a contact option anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Law

customer_reviews.title: FINALLY, A PERFECT STORAGE SOLUTION!!!
customer_reviews.text: After trying several different storage containers for both pet food and rice. I finally found a truly airtight and waterproof solution! I even keep one of these outdoors with bird seed in it and have had no issues with bugs or rainwater seeping in. It has held up perfectly in the elements with no discoloration, warping, or cracking. love how easily the lids screw on and off too. I now own four of these and would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Paul DeHart

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my bird seed to make it more convenient to access while keeping it outside. Somehow water got into it and 30 lbs. of seed molded and had to be thrown away, which cost more than the Vittles Vault. I'm very disappointed that I can't use it for the reason I bought it. Very disappointed! It is a very nice heavy plastic, but I think it needs a rubber seal on the lid to make it waterproof!
customer_reviews.author: Mary E

customer_reviews.title: Does the job.
customer_reviews.text: Well, the container does the job. I tried to fit a large bag of Purina Dog Chow, in the container but I couldn't fit it all in. No biggie. I only have two problems.... 1. The o-ring keeps coming off when I unscrew the lid. Its very annoying. 2. After I received this in the mail, I went to Home Goods, Tj Max, and Marshalls...i found the exact same container for 1/2 the price. I should have looked around first. Lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Harmon

customer_reviews.title: Keeps smells in and critters out!  ... unless you have really smart critters!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to store rabbit food in our garden shed to keep out the mice and rats. The 50 lb bag fit, no problem, and when the lid is on you can't smell the food at all. We've had it a few weeks now, and its doing it's job perfectly. Nothing is getting into the food! I'm very happy with this product, and plan to buy another to store our dog food. Update: The raccoons actually figured out how to get into this!!! It took them over a year, but it's not critter-tight for us anymore. :(
customer_reviews.author: Terryb

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Airtight Bird Seed Container
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this container because a previous one I had claimed to be airtight, they lied and earwigs were getting into the food. This was a thicker container and just looking at it could tell it was airtight. It holds a lot of bird seed, I was surprised by the amount it could hold. If I could change one thing about the container, it would be to add wheels, it is impossible for me to move it without wheels. It is a very nice product and would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: tmtracey720

customer_reviews.title: Very good container
customer_reviews.text: We're really pleased with the size and shape of this pet food container. The large opening makes it easy to fill, and easy to use a scoop for feeding. There are handles on all four sides, making it easy to grip if moving. The lid seats well and seals, but I don't spin it too tight, since I read a few reviews about the lids cracking. With a lid that size, it would be easy to use too much force. Consequently, I've had no problems. It keeps our expensive foods secure, fresh, and accessible. We liked the first one so much that we bought a second.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Extremely Functional
customer_reviews.text: I used this item for my two dogs because their food bags were enormous and a little bit of an eyesore. I purchased the 50 lb container and am waiting on the smaller container at the moment. Since we plan on keeping this in our outdoor Florida room, I was excited to find a product with an air-tight seal so that small bugs don’t have the opportunity to infiltrate my dogs’ livelihood (food). The other major perk is that the container comes with a large cup to scoop the food (my other reason for purchasing). Overall, extremely pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Katharine

customer_reviews.title: Just about impossible to open if you fully tighten the lid closed.
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty, fantastic seal from lid but as the subject line states I fully tightened the lid ONCE. Will never make that mistake again. Had to beat the cross members to open enough so I could get the lid off, I'm not a small guy (6'4") while not a weight lifter manage my own. The beating caused the cross member on the lid to distort, so repeats wouldn't be good. The material the bin is made from is great. Think it will last a life time unless someone else closes the lid and it has to be cut off.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Keeps food fresh and safe from clever doggos
customer_reviews.text: We used the built in velco in the earthborn food bags we were buying for about a year and a half until our golden retriever discovered that he could open the bag himself and treat himself to a feast. After the first time he ate 8lbs of kibble in one sitting, we decided to order one of these. Great decision. Keeps him out of the food, the kibble stays fresh longer, and this looks much neater than having a bag of food lying around. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: William G. Humber

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing...
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed overall with this product. I'm in Florida and this did not meet my expectations on freshness. My bird seed got mold within 2 weeks. Even opening daily to feed. This was kept in the garage so surprised that it did not keep moisture out. Had to throw away 1/2 of container contents. Will have to find other usages for this product. Wish they sold moisture packs with this item...hint..hint.
customer_reviews.author: BootsieBear

customer_reviews.title: Not Waterproof, doubt if they are airtight!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a portable dry storage solution to carry in the back of my pickup during outings. So far it has collected rainwater inside 2 out of two times I encountered mild weather. I am not talking a little bit of water here. It collected enough water to make the contents mushy and unusable. This container may work fine if it's kept inside under controlled conditions but is useless if used outdoors. I've owned Gamma Lids before and they had never failed like this! Apparently, they must have cut corners on the diameter of the gaskets used on this product.
customer_reviews.author: Chris G.

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Container for Storing Dog Food!!!
customer_reviews.text: 50 lbs Container is exactly as advertised. I love that it is easy to open and lid is easy to turn, large opening is 12 inches across. The container eliminates the smell of dog food and keeps it air-tight and fresh. It would be nice if the container was rodent-proof, but at least the ants cannot get in for now. The container will hold a 40 pound bag of dog food easily, with a few inches to spare from the top of the container. The lid turning motion opens and closes extremely easy with no effort. Container is a heavy duty durable plastic, this is VERY sturdy. Container will hold up for many, many years!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Big enough for 40# bag of food
customer_reviews.text: The container works well to keep the food fresh and secure, but the o-ring seal came off and won't stay on when I try to replace it. It still seals, but is more difficult to align the lid now when putting it back onto the vault.
customer_reviews.author: claywave

customer_reviews.title: I love these things
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 of these now, they are sturdy, and lightweight. I keep all the grain and birdseed in them for my outside animals. They keep everything fresh and they stack nicely on top pf each other no matter what size you purchase. This size can hold 50 pounds of grain which I love. The only down side is, squirrels can chew through the plastic, so I can't keep them outside but that is no big deal. Lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy S.

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the mess down from bags.
customer_reviews.text: We have two springers and burn thru a bag of dry in three weeks. Always dropping a few pieces here and there when we used a bag. Design of this container works for us. Square design with a large opening makes this a must have. You can use just about any scoop with no problems. Note: The lid is large thread with a great seal. Takes a little bit to learn how super easy it is to close the lid. It should always spend freely when closing!
customer_reviews.author: Dana H.

customer_reviews.title: Stores 100 pounds of Rice
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this container to store 50 pounds of rice. I assumed it would be roughly the same volume as a 50 pound bag of rice - but it is WAY bigger. I was shocked when it arrived. It is so large that I was actually able to fit 100 pounds of rice in it. The size is working for us right now because we are storing extra rice in case our family tele-school/tele-works due to the coronavirus - but I wish I had bought the 30 pound size instead.
customer_reviews.author: Canyon Mom

customer_reviews.title: 1st of 3 for current project - traditional Gamma quality
customer_reviews.text: Out of three Gamma vaults ordered this week, this unit (#1) was made well, the lid fit correctly and it did not leak when sprayed with water. Top notch - like many Gamma vaults in the past and five stars! I just blasted Gamma for defects in the 2nd and 3rd vaults though. For years, no other product has matched the utility of shape, waterproofing, strength and sealing, which this #1 of 3 vaults still has. - Sorry about #2 and #3 though; not so good.
customer_reviews.author: Tag Bunny

customer_reviews.title: Within 1 month, chipmunks were able to chew a ...
customer_reviews.text: Within 1 month, chipmunks were able to chew a 6 inch hole in the lid, making the container worthless. I have another brand for the last 20 years and have not had any problem with critters getting into the bird seed.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Great airtight container!
customer_reviews.text: This keeps our dog food super fresh!! Our old bun was NOT airtight but this one definitely is! Our dogs are way more excited for their food out of this then they were before. I am not at all worried about bugs getting in. It’s easy to open and close. Holds more than a 30 pound dog food bag. It is difficult to clean just because it is so deep but it doesn’t need to be cleaned often. I’m super happy with this product!
customer_reviews.author: Tom Dobozy

customer_reviews.title: Great storage bin
customer_reviews.text: I get 40lb bags of dog food from Costco, and this 50lb capacity is the perfect size. It even comes with a matching scoop! Since it's made out of plastic, it definitely needs to be aired out for at least a few hours upon arrival and opening. As a short person, the handle insets and dimensions make it portable when necessary, even when full of food. The lid screws off and on easily, and you can even get a spin on it and it screws itself shut if seated right initially. I've found no insects inside, and my dog is not able to open the container.
customer_reviews.author: Kirsten H.

customer_reviews.title: Dog Food Vault
customer_reviews.text: Works great & keeps food fresh. Used to just leave my dog food bags open and after a few days i noticed my dogs wouldn't eat their dry food as much as they did when the bag was just opened. Started to dump it in here and they eat it as if it was just opened from the bag on day 1. The only issue i have is that it states it's a 50LB capacity. I buy a 44LB bag and it all won't fit in there. Might be that different brands of food have different shapes and what not. So the 50LB capacity might be true for just a specific brand. But overall happy with this vault!
customer_reviews.author: Mike F

customer_reviews.title: It’s Not Pest Proof
customer_reviews.text: I bought for of these for dog food & birdseed. I live in a densely populated urban area. I keep them in my garage, house and on the porch. After a couple of weeks, the one with dog food in the garage and the one with birdseed on my porch had the lids and gaskets chewed through. So much for the patented pest-proof seal. I bought them so I could buy larger bags of stuff to save money but obviously that backfired. 😳.
customer_reviews.author: SoCal Gal

customer_reviews.title: not good to store chicken feed in if left by animals, will get chewed, totally ruined
customer_reviews.text: I bought these and they were not cheap, so I could put chicken feed in and after 2 weeks I noticed chew marks all over the rim and then a giant hole right through the top, and then the rubber ring was gone. I wouldn't recommend these for outside and I am sad that was 80 bucks down the drain and past my return window time. buy a steel can with a lid and save yourself the trouble.
customer_reviews.author: dianna six

customer_reviews.title: Waist my money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on January 31,19 and this is what happened. I just waisted $27.+ and I have to put the dog food in the microwave ad buy an small bag of food for three dogs.
customer_reviews.author: E. E. Luxenberg

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For Excess Litter Storage!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the 40 pound bags of cat litter which are the most inefficient things to reseal and store. This works perfectly! It's easy to put away (though heavy with litter, so we store it on the ground) and it's air tight. Previously if my cats found the litter bags, they'd get into them and make a mess. No such messes yet. I've not had to clean it yet aside from wiping down the outside after spilling something, but I imagine it'll be easy to clean out with a vacuum for any dry material.
customer_reviews.author: Mia

customer_reviews.title: Need larger than the 50 lb size for a 40 lb bag of dry dog food
customer_reviews.text: After reading several reviews etc I determined I should buy a 50 lb container to hold my 40 lb bags of dry dog food. This was not correct. The picture I'm providing is of the container with a 40 lb bag of dog food minus a few lbs as it was opened days ago. Add in what I fed my dogs before filling the container and it would not have all fit. So the 50 lb container will hold less than 40 lbs of dry dog food.
customer_reviews.author: Traci

customer_reviews.title: air tight container?
customer_reviews.text: I have a smaller container like this one and love it. The large one I received I cannot open or close it without struggling. I don't think the lid is made correctly. Since the lid is almost impossible to close, I am not sure it is air tight. I didn't send it back because I thought maybe the more I used it, the lid would get easier to open or close but I was wrong.
customer_reviews.author: ellen

customer_reviews.title: Good product with one complaint
customer_reviews.text: Great product and does what's it's intended for well. The only reason I don't give it 5 stars is it easily misses its threading when trying to screw on the lid so you might have to unscrew and correct placement then tighten again to fully seal the lid. Not a huge deal but when you have a bowl of dog food in one hand you want to easily close a CONTAINER without fussing with it. For me a 5 star product wouldn't have the issue. Still a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: DisKid

customer_reviews.title: These bins are great
customer_reviews.text: I have a variety of sizes of these TYPE of GAMMA2 bins.. They are airtight and a good use for dog food which keep the food fresh without bugs getting into the food. We have a problem with moths that will land in and burrow into dog food and bird food.(contaminating it) These BINS have worked well in eliminating the problem with moths. They work well for 25lb and 45lb's of brown rice too... Definitely recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: GJC

customer_reviews.title: Not watertight
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to store birdseed out on my deck. My seed started to ferment after a couple weeks. It is not watertight. Even with plastic over it and plastic in between the base and the top, water still gets in ..... Enough to get the birdseed wet after a rain. I may try to find some kind of gasket the size of the narrow existing ring seal. Otherwise it will end up being an expensive clothes hamper.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Hamill

customer_reviews.title: KEEPS FOOD SAFE FROM CRITTERS
customer_reviews.text: Very well made container with threads on the lid so wide that it is very easy and fast to open and close and has a very nice seal when closed. I bought two of them as we like to keep a back up of food on hand and they stack nicely on top of one another. If I did not have them stacked I would have to have used a table of some sort to raise them up otherwise you would have to bend over pretty far to reach them, especially when the food level gets low.
customer_reviews.author: FRANK STEVENSON

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and high quality
customer_reviews.text: I'm impressed with the build quality of this container. It's obviously a very sturdy plastic and the lid screws on and off easily. It may be a tad difficult to clean, but I don't think I'll have to deal with that too much. One plus to the size of this container is that I can fit my entire bag of pet food inside of it without having to dump the contents in the container. I could obviously fit more in the container if I dumped it, but I won't have to clean it as often if I just throw the whole bag in there.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Mihalik

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but so worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I thought it was going to look a little too tactical for my porch, but it's actually pretty nice! And the quality is excellent. My picky dog wasn't eating her food that we had in another storage container and as soon as we switched to this, she started chomping right up. Now that we have one of these, I don't think we'd ever buy anything else (or ever have to for that matter).
customer_reviews.author: taylor shuck

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had bought this years ago
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had bought this years ago. I used to store the dog food in a couple of Home Depot large paint-type containers stacked on top of one another. The smaller Gamma2 holds a 28-lb bag of kibble with room to spare. The lock-tight lid spins closed easily and the thick plastic keeps critters that may be in the garage out. I just read a review that someone puts the bag inside the Gamma2. I like this idea and will do that from now on to keep the oils and crumbs at bay.
customer_reviews.author: KR_H

customer_reviews.title: wonderful airtight and bug-proof storage
customer_reviews.text: we now have three of these. one for the cat food. one for the dog food. and we use one in the calving barn to keep the milk replacer. it keeps out all the bugs and dirt. and it keeps the dog and cat food fresher longer. sometimes when i'm in a hurry it takes a few tries to get it threaded back on and closed correctly but they are very handy to have. I like the different sizes available - each one of the three we have is a different size and they all seem to have very good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: I have since downgraded my review....
customer_reviews.text: After only 2 weeks of daily use, I have changed my review from 5 stars to 3. This morning the large thin rubber gasket fell into the kibble. Much too loose a fit. I'm not sure how that is possible- but it did. Since I an unable to use 6 hands to put this giant rubber gasket back on, I have downgraded this from 5 stars to 3. It should NOT have happened.
customer_reviews.author: Skyler

customer_reviews.title: Great containers
customer_reviews.text: I bought this larger size as the 35lb model I have couldn't hold the full amount of my dog's food (even though the bag is labelled 33lbs) When this one arrived the cover wouldn't spin smoothly, and I noticed the collar wasnt fully snaped down and would pop back up when I tried to force it. I actually removed the threaded collar piece (which took some force) and then trimmed some flashing (extra plastic from the molding process) from the rim of the container. Letting it sit the sun brought to container back to shape and the collar snapped down nicely and the cover now spins open and closed as it should.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Ordered one to keep the ants out (will update in the summer if it doesn’t work for that). It was exactly as specified, keeps the dog food smell in as wel. The only thing I’d say is refrain from closing it SUPER tight because it feels like it might crack from the pressure. Just tight enough to be a bit of a struggle to open not enough to break your fingers trying to open it up again. Scoop fits nicely in there and it’s been keeping the food fresh from what I can tell (again will update if anything changes)
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: complaints
customer_reviews.text: the lid fills with rain cuz I have it outside near my chicken pen & moisture gets inside and molds the feed I wasted $ on 2 of these Dont buy these unless you plan to keep them indoors
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Clark

customer_reviews.title: Great large airtight container
customer_reviews.text: Large container that is air tight. Screw on top created a good seal and helps keep the large quantity of food fresh. The plastic is tough and durable and does well on the floor of my garage, however it does slide around a little when trying to twist off/on the top lid. Some people have shown in pictures that they are able to get a large bag of food in, but they must be trying super hard because I haven't been able to easily get a 24lb bag of Pure Balance dog food in with any ease. Would recommend this container, especially for the price. I have not seen the larger 80lb version for a decent price.
customer_reviews.author: GregTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great dog food canister
customer_reviews.text: This is just what we needed to hold our pups dog food. She can't get in to her food and it stays fresh and out of the way. My only problem is that the lid is somewhat difficult to seed in the groves to screw the lid back on. It takes a couple tries going backwards and then forward before it catches on a straight angle so it doesn't go all crooked...
customer_reviews.author: Jana D.

customer_reviews.title: Not pest proof
customer_reviews.text: Well clearly not as pest proof as advertised. Need a replacement lid for the container now!?! Are these available anywhere?
customer_reviews.author: Kayla M.

customer_reviews.title: Lacks durability against squirrels
customer_reviews.text: Very nice design, and very easy to use. You simply unload the animal food into the container, and twist the lid until it closes. It's also lightweight so you can pick it up from the groves on the side. I like the overall design. However, I left this outside, and the squirrels are able to chew through the plastic. I am probably better with a stronger type of plastic or go with stainless steel material.
customer_reviews.author: Truc Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: It’s lasted 8 yrs.
customer_reviews.text: Has kept my dog’s food contained well. I bought the 50 lbs one in 2012 for 2 lg dogs. I loved it so much I bought the 30 lbs container a year later for the cat’s food, however the threaded part cracked so it keeps the food contained away from the dog’s, but won’t keep a large quantity fresh any longer. The 50lbs one has lasted 8 yrs and counting. The 30lbs was a disappointment when it cracked.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Renay

customer_reviews.title: Weather and critter proof
customer_reviews.text: I bought a smaller one for our inside dog to help keep her food fresh. It worked so well, I bought another one for our outside dogs. I initially bought it to store food outside for our neighbor to feed our dogs while we were in vacation. It keeps the food dry and pest free! We have continued using it outside well after our summer vacation. So far, there has been no weather damage to the outside or the kibble inside.
customer_reviews.author: Butterfly530

customer_reviews.title: Beware-poor support.
customer_reviews.text: The o- ring came off of the lid the first time I opened it. I have looked and looked and can’t seem to find replacement seals for the lids. What kind of company does that? Also, watch the inside of the container around the opening. It is extremely sharp and will easily draw blood. On the positive side, it does seem to be made from quality material, but the negatives greatly outweigh that single consideration.
customer_reviews.author: Eric W.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for fitting 40lb BAG inside!
customer_reviews.text: Wanted this to put the entire bag itself inside of the container as that is what’s recommended for best storage of pet food.. the 40lb Diamond Naturals Puppy Food bag fits perfectly inside after some wiggling to get it in so I’m happy! Can’t speak for the airtight seal yet as we haven’t used it for that yet but so far it’s great for what I needed!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Linaburg

customer_reviews.title: Good container but does not hold 50 pounds
customer_reviews.text: Good, sturdy container that seals well and won't allow access to your dogs food by anything that doesn't have opposable thumbs. It does not fit 50 pounds of food though. I have a 50 pound bag of dog food I was trying to put in the container and I still have about 6 pounds still in the bag because it wouldn't all fit. Still a great buy but keep that in mind if you're planning to store 50 pound bags of food
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fits exactly 1x 41 pound bag of dog food
customer_reviews.text: We switched foods and started getting a larger size bag (41pounds) because we have 2 large dogs. This holds one 41 pound bag of Purina Pro Plan perfectly (see photo- container was empty prior to filling with exactly one bag). I don’t think a full 50 pounds of dog food would fit in this based on our experience. Either way, we love that this will fit a full bag of food so we don’t have to store a half full bag of food just open in our closet and the container is air tight and keeps the food protected and fresh (granted we go through a bag every 2 weeks so can’t speak too much to the freshness).
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: I would love to contact the company for another rubber ring
customer_reviews.text: so I've ordered a number of these containers over the years and overall I love them, but unfortunately the rubber ring around the lid that actually makes it airtight and watertight tends to come off. And somehow it disappeared for my last container and now water gets in in the food molds. I'd love to contact the company just to get another ring, but I can't find any contact information at all for them on Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: William Navarro

customer_reviews.title: Works great for outdoor storage!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to store our dog food outdoors, and this has worked great. I buy 34 lb bags of dog food and leave it in the bag when putting it in the container. The 34 lb bag fits in there great, but you definitely could not fit anything larger (if you're keeping it in the bag). I heard that keeping the food in the bag keeps it more fresh, and you do not need to deal with washing out the container ever. I have not had any issues with bugs getting in there or anything else.
customer_reviews.author: CMan

customer_reviews.title: gasket keeps coming off.
customer_reviews.text: the weatherproof qualities of this feed bin are negated by a faulty lid gasket. bought this bin just before xmas and it's already failing. therefore, i cannot not recommend this product. i would return mine if i could.
customer_reviews.author: BlueChef1

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for about a year now, and it is still holding up. We have ours out back, and this week we have had what we assume is a raccoon come and try to haul it off. The lid stayed on exactly as it was supposed to. It had over 20 lbs of food in it and it didn't break either.
customer_reviews.author: Pid

customer_reviews.title: Keeps out ants and critters
customer_reviews.text: It is a great option against critters. Haven’t had any varmint get into it which is just what we needed out in the country. Unfortunately my dog is a pain and chewed up the lid super easily when he found out where we were keeping it. But it was nice enough so we’re buying it again and have it locked away accordingly.
customer_reviews.author: Jon1218

customer_reviews.title: Finicky lid
customer_reviews.text: I bought this not realizing how big it is! It’s huge! I guess I should have checked the size bag of dog food I typically buy. It does keep the food nice and fresh with an airtight seal but my only complain is that the lid can be finicky when twisting on. I get a little annoyed with how much I have to play with it to get it on the track.
customer_reviews.author: SKastelz

customer_reviews.title: Good airtight petfood storage container
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the Vittles Vault. Using it in my chicken run, where it easily holds 50# of feed. have been having a problem with moisture in the feed, and this solves it. Not sure this would hold up to persistent rodent chewing, but I've finally managed to fence them out. The galvanized garbage can wasn't keeping the food dry. This is an improvement. No bugs, no moisture in my feed.
customer_reviews.author: Linda A

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: Arrived undamaged. Everything was in place as it should be. Appears to be well constructed. I use it for my Pit Bulls 40 Lb. bag of dog food and keep it in my basement so it will not be in the elements. I mainly bought this to keep my dogs food fresh as he deserves the best! Only weird thing I noticed is that it "does not" sit flat on the floor and wobbles from side-to-side, which is something I can deal with. Overall for the price when I purchased it at ($19.00) was a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Child of God

customer_reviews.title: This has been great so far
customer_reviews.text: This has been great so far. I previously made the mistake of just buying a trash can and putting food in there, but after our dog got sick, we decided to reevaluate how we store his food - so we bought the vittles. The vittles is air tight, AND the big size fits a 30lb bag a dog food without having to pour it out, which is great, because it keeps the food fresh in the bag, and safe from critters. 10/10 would buy it again - will hopefully buy a smaller one for cat food down the line.
customer_reviews.author: Squeaks

customer_reviews.title: Has made a big difference in my pantry.
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrific solution in my pantry. Instead of having two large bags sitting on the floor, I now have this neat and tidy container. I have five large dogs and they go through a lot of dog food. This container fits almost both bags. It was easy to wash and dry when it arrived in great condition and on time. It seals well and I have been so happy I purchased it. Thinking of getting another for cat food, too.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia G.

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm even when the raccoons tried rolling it down our concrete stairs
customer_reviews.text: This is a very sturdy construction and the screw down lid works very well. There were definitely some animals trying to get into it at night, even went so far as to drag to our steps and roll it down many of our concrete stairs. A pretty impressive feat. Although it sustained some scratches nothing else happened and raccoons were denied their take away dinner.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of two elementary kiddos

customer_reviews.title: Best Dog Food Bin
customer_reviews.text: Can't buy a better dog food storage container. I put two 15# bags in there at a time side by side instead of dumping the food in it. It keeps everything cleaner and I only need one container to keep both separated and fresh. The bin will spin on you when trying to open if you don't have it against a wall or something that is sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: jadman69

customer_reviews.title: Love this Vittles Vault!
customer_reviews.text: I had a similar vault several years ago, but I used to open the kibble bag and pour the food in. The kibble would spill on the closet floor, and ants would come. After reading reviews, I bought a 50 lb Vittles Vault for my 25 lb bags of kibble - the entire bag slips into the vault very nicely! This way, I don't have to pour the kibble in and worry about spilling, and I also don't have to worry about cleaning out old kibble pieces. We have an ant problem, and I'm looking forward to keeping the kibble safe.
customer_reviews.author: jib

customer_reviews.title: WOW - my dog food & bird seed stay fresh!
customer_reviews.text: I used to keep my dog food & bird seed in the garage in their own regular bag. However, not anymore. The birdseed had mold and the dog food had little critters living at the bottom of the bag. Since then, I have put my dog food & bird seed into these vaults and PERFECTION!! No bugs, no mold and the dog food stays nice and crunchy & fresh. I highly recommend, plus the price is amazing. They were twice as much at TJ's. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: F R A U D
customer_reviews.text: This is fraud. The device smells carcinogenic. The device is not airtight. Water and air exchange past the seal. I compared the seal to the one in another lid, supposedly by the same manufacturer, and it was totally different. The seal on this product is not sticky like the other, is half the diameter, and not the same material. I was happy that a credit without a return of the item was automatically approved tho.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Gerard

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Dog Food Container
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite container to store dog food it. It is dog proof and bug proof. It is air tight so no ants and bugs are attracted to it. It keeps the dog food fresh. It comes with a great measuring cup. This product is made from durable material. Great price too. I recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Sydney Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Be Ware of the size before you buy
customer_reviews.text: It was way way too large for what I wanted I kept one with wild bird seed in it if you don't keep it closed the seed will mold I gave the other one to my sister so she could putPotting soil in it
customer_reviews.author: joanne Badilla

customer_reviews.title: 50 gallon storage container.
customer_reviews.text: Quite literally bomb proof. I have had one for nearly 10 years and it is as good as the day I bought it. Will get a smaller one for the dogs treats. These would also be nice for canoe tripping or even a prepper stash of food and supplies. It is water tight and at no time have I had bugs. I liked it so much I have purchased a second one. If I had a complaint I'd say it's a little expensive but if you find it on sale as I did it is well worth it. It's worth it at 50 but my price of 35 I think it was a no brainer.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Hopper

customer_reviews.title: Perfect food storage
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to hold a 12 lb box of Butler soy curls and they fit perfect. This lid spins on easily and seals tight. It was easy to wash and I opened to air it out a few days before use. I need to get a few more for my bulk gluten-free pasta and rolled oats. These are great hurricane prepper containers to store other items such as toiletries, towels and first aid supplies that you don't want to get wet.
customer_reviews.author: F. Bamboo

customer_reviews.title: I love this container
customer_reviews.text: I was keeping my dog treats in a tote until a squirrel decided he wanted to eat a hole in the tote and steal dog bones. This container allows me to continue to store the food outside and it is hard plastic so the squirrels cant eat thru it. I have one for dog food and one for dog treats.
customer_reviews.author: MIA

customer_reviews.title: Great storage product.
customer_reviews.text: Although this is water proof and excellent for storing peanuts for the squirrels, I was AMAZED that the stupid squirrels chewed right through the lid, a hole large enough for them to go in and out and help themselves to the peanuts! Guess I needed a stainless steel container to keep squirrels out!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Large, durable, and reliable storage for my dog food
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been looking into dog food storage options for a while and while this might be a little higher priced it’s paid for itself in just two dog food bags already. Has a rubber seal that keeps container airtight and prevents ants and other bugs from being able to enter. I find the top opening the easiest as I’m able to easily reach in and grab the food all the way down to the last scoops
customer_reviews.author: SAJ

customer_reviews.title: Great storage solution
customer_reviews.text: Works great for keeping my dog's food sealed. Bought this after a mouse somehow got into my garage and contaminated two 40 lb bags of food. Chased the mouse out immediately but the damage was done and $60 of food had to be trashed. Now that I keep my dog's food in this nicely sealed container I don't worry about it getting contaminated in case a little critter ever sneaks it's way into my garage again. Definitely buy this if you want a secure storage solution for your pets food.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good basic container.
customer_reviews.text: I'd change the handle indents so that they'd point in and up. The way they're currently designed it's difficult to get a firm grip. The plastic seems to be the hard, tends to shatter, type which has left me with cracked storage containers in the past. Hopefully I'm guessing incorrectly. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

product_meta.title: Gamma2 Vittles Vault Outback Airtight Pet Food Storage Container
product_meta.description: Size:50 PoundAirtight/Watertight Space Efficient Square Style with Molded Handles Amazon.com Gamma2 Vittles Vault Square Containers Pets come in all shapes and sizes and so do pet food containers. That's why we created the Vittles Vault Prime line - these containers are designed to be the Best in Class and keep your dry pet food fresh and pest free. Lock-Down double gaskets and storage efficient shapes make the Vittles Vault Prime the ultimate choice. Premium features and heavy duty construction allow these containers to last for decades--literally! Airtight Heavy Duty Easy Spin On / Off lid Lock-Down Double Gaskets Molded handles Stackable Made from High Density Polyethylene, Food Grade Plastic. BPA free. We care about the safety and storage of food, for people and pets! Vittles Vaults are completely recyclable. Weights are estimates and will vary based on size and density of kibble. Supplied parts: Container with Screw on/off threaded gasketed lid and a one cup scoup. Replacement lids and/or gaskets are available online. Care -We recommend thoroughly washing and drying your Vittles Vault container regularly. Over time, oils absorb into the plastic, which can cause food to become rancid. When that happens, your furry friend won't want to eat it.
feature_bullets: Airtight Pet Food Container: This pest-proof pet food container for dry food keeps food fresh with our patented airtight sealing system that locks moisture out. Design is stackable for space efficiency. Includes scoop

Food Storage Container: The pet food pail is made of food-grade, BPA-free HDPE plastic that won't shatter if dropped & can be kept in garages, barns & outdoors. Perfect for dry food, treats, bird seed & horse feed
Airtight Engineering: Our Gamma Seal technology makes for a controlled moisture balance & features a threaded locking system with reliable double gaskets for freshness & controlled moisture

Made In America: GAMMA2, Inc. created & patented an airtight container in 1989 & has always been committed to manufacturing in the USA. Our storage containers provide a solution in pet food staleness&ensures dry pet food stays fresh & protected from pests

GAMMA2: Dog & cat dry food stays fresh & nutritious with our collection of airtight food containers. Features wall mounted containers, travel, pantry & kitchen containers & larger containers for large dogs & horses

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
